message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of sunlight on our skin. Sitting in a truck bed allows you to directly expose your skin to the sunlight, which can warm it up. Option (A) is incorrect because sitting near a fan does not involve sunlight. Option (B) is incorrect because an igloo would block the sunlight. Option (C) is incorrect because sitting under an umbrella would also block the sunlight.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of sunlight on the skin. Sunlight contains ultraviolet (UV) rays, which can warm the skin. Option (D) suggests riding in a truck bed, which would expose the skin to direct sunlight and therefore warm it. Option (A) is incorrect because sitting near a fan has no impact on skin temperature. Option (B) is incorrect because sitting in an igloo would block sunlight and prevent warming of the skin. Option (C) is incorrect because sitting under an umbrella would also block sunlight and prevent warming of the skin.
